pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:6.3: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:6.4: At that time the nuns from the group of six traveled in vehicles.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:6.6: “How can the nuns travel in a vehicle? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six travel in a vehicle?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.7: How can the nuns from the group of six travel in a vehicle?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:8.2: ‘If a nun travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:9.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:10.2: At one time there was a sick nun, and she was not able to travel on foot. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:10.4: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to use a vehicle.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:10.5: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:11.1: ‘If a nun who is not sick travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:12.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:17.1: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:17.2: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:18.1: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:18.3: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.
